body.p: Harrodsburg, Kentucky, resident and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Benjamin C. Allin and Susan H. Allin. Resident of Mercer County, Kentucky in 1850. Household owned seven enslaved persons in Mercer County in 1850. Resident in Harrodsburg in 1860. Household owned two enslaved persons in Harrodsburg in 1860. Enlisted as a private in the 2nd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (C.S.A.) in 1862.
